item.title: The Wolf Of All Streets â€“ "I Lost $2.5 Billion While The Government Destroyed Crypto Investors" | Charles Hoskinson
item.description:
Charles Hoskinson Founder of IOHK & Cardano reflects on the crypto industry's turbulent past four years, marked by regulatory chaos, failed projects, and political mismanagement, which wiped out retail investors and left altcoins stagnant while Bitcoin became institutionalized. He emphasizes that 2026 is not a typical bull market but a necessary reset, driven by the need for a new generation of protocols focused on rational privacy, smart compliance, and chain abstraction that simplify user experience and enable mass adoption. Despite significant setbacks, including his own $2.5 billion paper loss, Charles remains optimistic about the future, comparing the upcoming crypto evolution to Amazonâ€™s transformation, where real utility and global decentralization will drive growth, reclaim retail trust, and resist Wall Streetâ€™s institutional grip, ultimately shaping a stronger, privacy-centered, and politically neutral crypto ecosystem.

]]>

item.title: What Bitcoin Did â€“ Only Bitcoin Can Stop Government Corruption | Peter McCormack
item.description:
Peter McCormack is back on the show for a conversation on power, the state of the UK, and why the system is broken. We get into how debt, inflation, and centralised government incentives have hollowed out public services, destroyed the middle class, and turned politics into a fight over power rather than outcomes. Peter explains why inflation is the real tax, why asset inflation benefits elites at the expense of everyone else, and why neither the left nor the right is willing or able to fix the underlying problem.

item.description:
In this conversation, OG Bring Facts shares his experiences with living in an earth home and his journey into Bitcoin. He discusses the importance of self-sufficiency, sustainable living, and the impact of Bitcoin on personal finance. The conversation also touches on health, lifestyle changes, and the Bitcoin community, as well as predictions for the future of Bitcoin and the economy. OG Bring Facts expresses his desire for freedom and adventure, contemplating a move to El Salvador while reflecting on political views and personal experiences.

item.title: Unchained â€“ DEX in the City: Why Prediction Market 'Insider Trading' Isn't Illegal â€” Yet
item.description:
Thank you to our sponsor, Mantle!

Canton's in bed with Nasdaq, a Google DeepMind's paper talks up the role of blockchain in an agentic economy and an alleged insider cashes in on Maduro's capture.

In this DEX in the City episode, hosts Katherine Kirkpatrick Bos, Jessi Brooks and Vy Le dive into the implications of Canton's Nasdaq deal, why DeepMind's study matters for crypto and the legality of insider trading on prediction markets.

Vy highlights what Canton's Nasdaq deal signals about the priorities of institutions adopting blockchain technology. Katherine and Jessi engage in what happens when the machines take over. Plus, should federal officials be banned from using prediction markets?

Hosts:

  • Jessi Brooks
  • Katherine Kirkpatrick Bos
  • TuongVy Le

Links:

  • Bitcoin Rallies to $93,000 After U.S. Attack on Venezuela
  • How the x402 Standard Is Enabling AI Agents to Pay Each Other
  • Why the Black Friday Whaleâ€™s $192 Million Crypto Trade Was Legal
  • DEX in the City: Insider Trading and Crypto: What the Law Actually Says
  • Google DeepMindâ€™s agentic economy paper
  • Pawthereum's website
  • A copy of Rep. Ritchie's bill

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices

]]>

item.description:
In Episode 21 of The â‚¿roadcast, Bram Kanstein, Michael Tanguma, and Brian Cubellis break down the most important Bitcoin and macro developments from the past few weeks.


The conversation centers on Morgan Stanleyâ€™s Bitcoin ETF filing, what it really signals about institutional demand, and why the shift from â€œallowedâ€ to â€œrecommendedâ€ marks a new phase of adoption. From AI-driven abundance and information slop to Bitcoinâ€™s role as a verifiable truth anchor, the episode connects Wall Street, custody, regulation, energy, and game theory into a single framework.

item.title: The Mustard Seedâ€”a bitcoin and long-term thinking podcast â€“ Bitcoin to $10,000,000 with Rajat Soni
item.description:
Bitcoin stands as a transformational tool for saving and capital allocation in a digital world. Rajat Soni explains how legacy finance models break down when applied to bitcoin and why the characteristics of money matter more than traditional valuation models. Viewers will gain a clear framework for thinking in decades and for understanding how Wall Street will eventually reprice the economy in bitcoin terms.


Timestamps:

00:00 - Introduction and goals for the episode

01:06 - Rajat Soniâ€™s background in fixed income management

10:01 - How loan collateral works in bitcoin

12:19 - Why bitcoin functions as money

16:30 - Misconceptions about intrinsic value

18:09 - Characteristics of effective money

22:00 - Global demand for bitcoin as a medium of exchange

25:38 - Real estate as a savings vehicle

31:01 - Incentives shaping economies with bitcoin

34:19 - Bitcoinâ€™s long-term outlook

40:06 - Future implications for investors

56:07 - Digital credit instruments and bitcoin

57:12 - Closing remarks and where to follow Rajatâ€™s work

item.title: The Bitcoin Frontier â€“ Dictators fuel bitcoin adoption with Anna Chekhovich | The Last Free Americans
item.description:
Anna Chekhovich is a Russian activist who manages the Anti-Corruption Foundationâ€™s finances while living in exile. She runs payrolls, budgeting, and fundraising for a movement that faces surveillance, asset seizures, and sanctions. What sets Anna apart is her operational playbook for keeping an organization alive when banks fail you. In this episode, Anna joins The Last Free Americans to share how bitcoin became ACFâ€™s plan B for payroll and donations, how activists build practical off-ramps under hostile regimes, and how she co-designed a simple three-day training that now serves activists from more than 50 countries.Â

item.itunes:summary:
Anna Chekhovich is a Russian activist who manages the Anti-Corruption Foundationâ€™s finances while living in exile. She runs payrolls, budgeting, and fundraising for a movement that faces surveillance, asset seizures, and sanctions. What sets Anna apart is her operational playbook for keeping an organization alive when banks fail you. In this episode, Anna joins The Last Free Americans to share how bitcoin became ACFâ€™s plan B for payroll and donations, how activists build practical off-ramps under hostile regimes, and how she co-designed a simple three-day training that now serves activists from more than 50 countries.Â

item.title: Once Bitten! A Bitcoin Podcast. â€“ Why Did Orange Pill App Rebrand To Club Orange? Matteo Pellegrini. #586
item.description:
Are you still a lonely Bitcoin Pleb?

$ BTC 90,200

Block Height 931,395

Today's guest on the show is Matteo Pellegrini, CEO and founder of Club Orange, previously known as Orange Pill App.

Why did Matteo decide to change the name from Orange Pill App to Club Orange?

What rabbit holes did he fall down when researching different names and what's the 'science' behind name and logo branding?

What challenges did Matteo face in the early days of launching the App, and how has AI completely changed the flow of the company's development over the last year?

Why does Matteo think that 'In Real Life' meetings will start to flourish over the next few years, and why is it important for Bitcoiners to start coming together more naturally?

Join Club Orange and come say hi!

https://signup.cluborange.org/co/princey

Key Topics:

  • Rebranding from Orange Pill App to Club Orange
  • The Growth and User Base of Club Orange
  • Bitcoin Treasury and Revenue
  • The Shift from Online to Real-Life Connections
  • AI's Impact on Online Interactions
  • Privacy and Data Surveillance
  • Noster and Decentralized Communication
  • New Features: Wallet, Geo-Zapping, and Ticketing
  • The Future of Club Orange and Bitcoin

item.title: Swan Signal Live - A Bitcoin Show â€“ Healthy Hopium: Bitcoin Adoption Curve, ETF Stickiness, and Trump Shockwaves
item.description:
• Bitcoin holds around ~$90K as Brady and John frame the current range as a â€œhigher floorâ€ era with potential upside catalysts still intact
  • â€œHealthy hopiumâ€ segment compares Bitcoin adoption to the internetâ€™s S-curve and revisits how skeptics routinely dismiss exponential technologies
  • Discussion of long-horizon Bitcoin returns using a â€œwealth tableâ€ framing: short-term noise, long-term trend clarity
  • Lynn Aldenâ€™s view: recent selloff lows may hold as liquidity conditions improve and excess â€œBitcoin treasury companyâ€ activity gets washed out
  • ETF adoption story accelerates: Morgan Stanley launches branded Bitcoin and Solana ETFs, notably skipping Ethereum
  • Bank of America/Merrill opens advisor access to multiple spot Bitcoin ETFs with a framed 1â€“4% allocation for suitable clients
  • ETF flows remain resilient: outflows are modest relative to the drawdown, suggesting a stickier, longer-term holder base
  • Macro/politics: Supreme Court tariff case is approaching a decision, with markets likely reacting in a messy, sector-specific way rather than a clean â€œtariffs on/offâ€ binary
  • Housing policy: Trump floats MBS buying to compress mortgage spreads and proposes restricting institutional purchases of single-family homes, with questions on feasibility and real impact
  • Defense policy whiplash: conflicting announcements trigger sharp moves in defense stocks, highlighting policy-driven volatility risk

    • Swan Private helps HNWI, companies, trusts, and other entities go beyond legacy finance with BItcoin. Learn more at swan.com/private.  
     

    Put Bitcoin into your IRA and own your future. Check out swan.com/ira.


    Swan Vault makes advanced Bitcoin security simple. Learn more at swan.com/vault.


     

    ]]>

item.title: The Peter McCormack Show â€“ #139 - Simon Dixon - How the Financial-Industrial Complex Runs the World
item.description:
Western politics appears chaotic - broken states, endless debt and permanent crisis. Simon Dixon argues it isn't chaos at all, it's structure.

In this conversation, Simon lays out how money creation, debt, asset management, and access to capital now matter more than elections, ideology, or national borders. Governments, he argues, have become balance sheets and citizens have become collateral.

We talk about how the debt-based system works, why rolling over debt keeps everything alive, how asset managers shape outcomes and why wars, bailouts, inflation, and social breakdown all follow the same incentives. It's about power, money, and who actually makes decisions, and what that means for people trying to live normal lives inside a system that no longer works for them.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

TIMESTAMPS: 00:00:00 â€“ Introduction 00:02:41 â€“ Power Dynamics vs Democracy 00:06:59 â€“ IMF Bailouts and Rolling Debt 00:10:28 â€“ the British Empire Financial Model 00:16:31 â€“ Blackrock, Capital Allocation & Board Control 00:18:43 â€“ Why Ceos Aren't Really in Charge 00:25:00 â€“ Why Revolutions Fail 00:27:56 â€“ Russia, Sovereignty & Oil 00:30:00 â€“ Ukraine, Nato, and Arms Incentives 00:34:10 â€“ Profit, War, and Moral Cost 00:38:34 â€“ Compromise, Power & Politics 00:41:53 â€“ Immigration and Instability 00:45:29 â€“ Surveillance, Data & Control 00:47:07 â€“ Venezuela, Oil & Geopolitics 00:55:25 â€“ When Debt Actually Breaks 01:03:08 â€“ Why Stock Markets Rise as Countries Fail 01:06:30 â€“ the Collapse of Living Standards 01:12:25 â€“ Multipolar World Order 01:16:18 â€“ Bitcoin as Boycott 01:24:00 â€“ Who Survives the System 01:28:51 â€“ Leaving the West vs Staying 01:47:32 â€“ Property, Debt & Freedom 01:49:20 â€“ Advice for People Who Can't Escape 01:57:19 â€“ What Actually Breaks the System 02:02:15 â€“ Final Reflections: Playing the Game Without Losing Yourself

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

CONTACT PETE â€º Website â€“ http://petermccormack.com â€º Feedback â€“ https://www.petermccormack.com/contact â€º Email â€“ me@petermccormack.com â€º Instagram â€“ /mccormack555 â€º X/Twitter â€“ https://x.com/petermccormack/

CONNECT WITH SIMON DIXON â€º Website â€“ https://www.simondixon.com/ â€º Twitter â€“ https://x.com/SimonDixonTwitt

SPONSORS â€º Ledger - https://www.ledger.com/ â€º Gemini - https://gemini.com/

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

LISTEN / SUBSCRIBE â€º Apple Podcasts: https://apple.co/40ruY9K â€º Spotify: https://spoti.fi/3Wc94Vu â€º Fountain: https://bit.ly/FountainPM â€º YouTube: https://bit.ly/YouTube_PM â€º Rumble: https://bit.ly/RumblePM

FILMED BY CURTIS TAYLOR â€º https://www.curttaylor.co.uk/ â€º https://x.com/curttayloruk/

EDITED BY CONOR MCCORMACK â€º https://x.com/ConorM04

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

item.title: Store of Bitcoin - Bitcoin as Store of Value â€“ Ep. 48 - Robin seyr | The Main Winner of 2026 will be Bitcoin
item.description:
In this episode of the Store of Bitcoin podcast, host Alessandro Ottaviani interviews Robin Cher, a prominent figure in the Bitcoin community known for his long-form discussions on the implications of Bitcoin. They explore the evolution of Robin's podcast, the barriers to mass adoption of Bitcoin, the importance of user experience, and the future of Bitcoin in light of current market trends. Robin shares insights on self-custody, the impact of Bitcoin on individuals, and predictions for the future, particularly focusing on the year 2026.

This episode is sponsored by â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â BitVaultâ â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â â , the new open-source & self-custody wallet utilizing time-delays and multisignature to offset physical attacks and hacks.

item.title: Rob Wallace | Bitcoin News â€“ Why I Sold Millions in Houses, Cars and Watches for Bitcoin | Chris Johnson
item.description:
What would make someone sell millions worth of luxury goods? For Chris Johnson, the answer was simple: Bitcoin is the final trade.

In this powerful interview, Chris joins Rob Wallace and breaks down his incredible journey, from growing up in poverty and serving in Iraq to building successful businesses and ultimately going all-in on Bitcoin. He explains why he left traditional assets behind, the mindset shift that led him to see Bitcoin as a moral and financial imperative, and how the fiat system fails those trying to build real wealth.

What Youâ€™ll Learn:

â€¢ Why Chris liquidated millions in real estate, watches, and stocks

â€¢ How inflation and fiat miseducation led him to Bitcoin

â€¢ Building wealth from 0: side hustles, e-commerce, and investing

â€¢ The hidden costs of the fiat system and why Bitcoin fixes this

â€¢ How to escape paycheck-to-paycheck living

â€¢ The mindset shift from consumerism to sovereignty

]]>

item.title: Stephan Livera Podcast â€“ Has Lightning Quietly Succeeded? with Nate (Beeforbacon) | SLP708
item.description:
In this conversation, I discuss with Nate the current state and future prospects of the Lightning Network as of December 2025. They explore various aspects such as payment success rates, public perception versus practitioner insights, routing fees, centrality in nodes, yield opportunities, privacy considerations, and the overall adoption of the Lightning Network. The discussion highlights the improvements made over the years, the economic incentives for node operators, and the importance of community-driven initiatives in shaping the future of the Lightning Network.

=Takeaways:

ğŸ”¸The Lightning Network has improved payment success rates over time.

ğŸ”¸Public perception of the Lightning Network often differs from actual usage statistics.

ğŸ”¸Routing fees are crucial for maintaining liquidity and economic incentives in the network.

ğŸ”¸Centrality in Lightning nodes affects payment success and routing efficiency.

ğŸ”¸Yield opportunities exist for those operating Lightning nodes.

ğŸ”¸Adoption of the Lightning Network is expected to grow as more enterprises recognize its benefits.

ğŸ”¸Privacy in Lightning transactions is nuanced and requires careful management.

ğŸ”¸Innovations in Lightning technology continue to enhance user experience and functionality.

ğŸ”¸The future of the Lightning Network may involve more integration with traditional financial systems.

ğŸ”¸Community-driven initiatives are essential for the growth and improvement of the Lightning Network.

Timestamps:00:00 Intro

02:53 Current State and Performance of the Lightning Network

05:58 Public Perception vs. Practitioner Insights

08:53 Routing and Payment Success Rates

11:55 Fee Structures and Yield in Lightning Network

14:56 The Evolution of Lightning Node Operations

17:56 Centralization Concerns in the Lightning Network

27:45 Hub and spoke model?

30:14 Privacy Concerns in Lightning Network

32:41 The Centralization Debate in Lightning Network

35:43 Merchant Adoption of Bitcoin Payments

38:47 The Role of Bitcoin as a Medium of Exchange

40:53 Exploring Lightning Network Implementations

45:36 Recommendations for Different User Types

50:45 Comparing Lightning Network with Alternative Solutions

54:52 Enhancing Bitcoin's Functionality

57:37 The Future of Bitcoin Development

59:59 Bitcoin Myths and Misconceptions

01:06:05 Lightning Network Adoption and Innovations

01:11:01 Privacy in the Lightning Network

]]>

item.title: Bitcoin Policy Institute â€“ Congressman Warren Davidson Unveils the â€œBitcoin for America Actâ€ | Spotlight Series #1
item.description:
In this exclusive interview, Congressman Warren Davidson announces the introduction of the Bitcoin for America Act, legislation that could redefine how the United States adopts Bitcoin and how Americans fulfill their tax obligations.Hosted by Conner Brown, Head of Strategy at the Bitcoin Policy Institute (BPI), this premiere episode of the BPI Spotlight Series explores:â€¢ Codifying the Strategic Bitcoin Reserveâ€¢ Allowing Americans to pay federal taxes in Bitcoinâ€¢ Eliminating capital gains taxes when Bitcoin is used for tax paymentsâ€¢ Strengthening national security and economic resilience through sound moneyâ€¢ Preserving financial privacy in a digital eraâ€¢ Encouraging grassroots adoption and opt-in contributions to a national Bitcoin reserveâ€¢ Reestablishing the United States as the global leader in Bitcoin innovationWhy it matters:The United States faces unprecedented debt pressures and growing competition over the future of money. Davidson argues that Bitcoin provides a durable path toward financial stability, technological leadership, and renewed economic freedom for the American people.Key topics covered:â€¢ Bitcoin tax reform and de minimis payment exemptionsâ€¢ National competitiveness in the digital asset economyâ€¢ Inflation, fiscal policy, and sovereign savings strategyâ€¢ CBDC risks and the importance of privacy-preserving moneyâ€¢ Gen Z financial opportunity and long-term savingsFor viewers interested in Bitcoin policy, economic strategy, and Americaâ€™s financial future, this discussion offers essential insight into how forward-looking legislation could shape the decades ahead.Contact your elected representatives and encourage support for the Bitcoin for America Act.Subscribe for more policy-focused interviews and expert research from the Bitcoin Policy Institute.

]]>

item.title: Bitcoin & Beyond | Dein Geld neu denken â€“ Strategy und der Beinahe-Rauswurf aus dem MSCI World
item.description:
Es war eine Nachricht, die viele Anleger im Krypto-Space aufschreckte: Strategy drohte der Rausschmiss aus wichtigen ETFs. Seit Oktober grassierte diese Sorge an der Wall Street â€“ und drÃ¼ckte den Kurs. Der Indexanbieter MSCI hatte darÃ¼ber nachgedacht, sogenannte Treasury-Firmen zu verbannen. Ihr GeschÃ¤ftsmodell ist so simpel wie umstritten: Schulden aufnehmen, Bitcoin kaufen, Rendite machen. Nun ist die Entscheidung gefallen: Strategy darf in Indizes wie dem MSCI World bleiben â€“ vorerst. Doch gebannt sind die Risiken damit noch lange nicht. In dieser Folge spricht Philipp mit Ha Duong, Portfoliomanager von BIT Capital, darÃ¼ber

  • warum der ETF-Exodus doch noch anstehen kann,
  • wieso das GeschÃ¤ftsmodell von Strategy dennoch beschnitten wird
  • und ob sich die Strategy-Aktie fÃ¼r Anleger jetzt doch wieder lohnt.

AuÃŸerdem gehtâ€™s um Bitcoin-Prognosen fÃ¼r 2026.

Disclaimer: Dieser Podcast ist keine Anlageberatung, sondern dient lediglich der Information und Unterhaltung. Die Hosts oder der Verlag Ã¼bernehmen keine Haftung fÃ¼r Anlageentscheidungen, die ihr aufgrund der im Podcast gehÃ¶rten Informationen trefft.

Ihr habt Fragen rund ums Thema KryptowÃ¤hrungen? Dann schreibt gerne eine E-Mail an philipp.frohn@wiwo.de. Gerne beantworten wir sie in einer der nÃ¤chsten Folgen.

Wenn ihr noch tiefer in Themen rund um BÃ¶rse, Finanzen und MÃ¤rkte eintauchen mÃ¶chten und noch nicht regelmÃ¤ÃŸig die WirtschaftsWoche lesen, dann haben wir ein gutes Angebot: Testet WiWo+ jetzt vier Wochen lang fÃ¼r nur einen Euro. Ihr erhaltet Zugriff auf alle Inhalte im Web und in der App â€“ und auf Wunsch unser Magazin freitags druckfrisch in den Briefkasten. Sichert euch euren Probemonat unter wiwo.de/starten

Helft uns, unsere Podcasts weiter zu verbessern. Eure Meinung ist uns wichtig: www.wiwo.de/zufriedenheit

item.title: No Second Best - A Bitcoin Podcast â€“ Elon Says the Singularity Is Here â€” Is Bitcoin Ready?
item.description:
Elon Musk says 2026 is the year of the singularity. AI, robotics, and automation are collapsing costs, accelerating productivity, and reshaping the global economy. This episode explains what AI-driven abundance means for money and why Bitcoin strengthens, not weakens, as deflation, energy constraints, settlement, and sound money matter more than ever.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rni7Fz7208c https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wtW6ESSmKKY https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VRA8VIsO-rQ

item.title: Coin Stories with Natalie Brunell â€“ Col. Douglas Macgregor: Why I Sold Bitcoin â€” Coming Crash, Gold Reserve Status, and China's Grip on our Military
item.description:
Natalie Brunell sits down with her #1 guest, retired U.S. Army Colonel Douglas Macgregor, to unpack an uncomfortable reality: America's national security depends on supply chains tied to China. Decades of money printing and financialization helped create billionaires and politically connected elites while hollowing out the industrial base we'd need in a real crisis. Topics:

  • Is GOLD the new reserve currency instead of the U.S. Dollar?
  • How reliant the U.S. military and defense industry is on China
  • The reason the U.S. went into Venezuela
  • Why Macgregor sold his bitcoin and thinks he'll be able to buy back at lower prices
  • The "financial armageddon" he believes is comingâ€”and what breaks first

Follow Col. Macgregor on X at https://x.com/DougAMacgregor

----

Order Natalie's new book "Bitcoin is For Everyone," a simple introduction to Bitcoin and what's broken in our current financial system: https://amzn.to/3WzFzfU

---

Coin Stories is powered by Gemini. Invest as you spend with the Gemini Credit Card. Sign up today to earn a $200 intro Bitcoin bonus. The Gemini Credit Card is issued by WebBank. See website for rates & fees. Learn more at https://www.gemini.com/natalie

----

With Ledn, you get custody loans, no credit checks, no monthly payments, and more. Get .25% off your first loan, learn more at https://www.Ledn.io/natalie

item.title: Beyond Bitcoin Community â€“ Worbli Talks - WORBLI Tech And EOSIO - With Robert Dewilder WORBLI Co - Founder And CTO
item.description:
<![CDATA[An interview with WORBLI CTO (Chief Technical Officer) on the technology that WORBLI is built on, some of the advantages it has as it relates to the financial industry and some of the upcoming things we can expect from WORBLI.
WORBLI is a financial services district where enterprises and individuals can access a broad range of services that are built on WORBLI's blockchain. Our blockchain ecosystem leverages EOSIO software and is capable of hosting a variety of decentralized applications (dApps) focused on financial innovation, free transactions, security, reliability, and compliance.
To summarize the current challenge; crypto presents a very high barrier to entry and a lot of red tape for consumers and businesses, and WORBLI is here to resolve this.

item.title: Bitcoin Magazine Podcast â€“ BTC v MSCI: The Fight to Keep Bitcoin Companies in Global Indexes w/ George Mekhail | BFC Show Ep 21
item.description:
MSCI is considering a rule change that could remove Bitcoin treasury companies from global equity indexes. This episode explores why that move misunderstands how corporate bitcoin adoption actually works. From preferred equity structures to operating company fundamentals, the panel explains whatâ€™s really at stake.Bitcoin For Corporations is calling on MSCI to withdraw its 50% digital-asset exclusion rule. item.title: Dein Weg zu Bitcoin â€“ Unser Geldsystem ist genauso KAPUTT wie vor 100 Jahren â€“ Dein Weg zu Bitcoin mit Tino
item.description:
Bitcoin-Buchautor, Immobilienkaufmann und VHS-Dozent: Tino Jahnz aka bitcoin_dino erzÃ¤hlt, warum â€Geld nicht aus dem Nichts kommtâ€œ, wieso die breite Masse Bitcoin nicht technisch verstehen muss â€“ und warum Immobilien (aus seiner Sicht!) risikobehafteter sind als Bitcoin. Ein ehrlicher Einstieg Ã¼ber Konsum, Freiheit und Eigenverantwortung.


In dieser Folge erfÃ¤hrst du:

â€¢ Tino: Immobilienkaufmann aus dem Emsland, Familienvater, VHS-VortrÃ¤ge fÃ¼r Einsteiger

â€¢ Warum er ein einfaches Bitcoin-Buch schrieb, inspiriert durch seine VHS-Kurse â€“ und was es mit der Taschenlampe auf sich hat

â€¢ Was Alex von Frankenberg zu seinem Buch sagt

â€¢ Die breite Masse muss Bitcoin nicht verstehen (so wie beim Internet/Auto)

â€¢ Du erfÃ¤hrst: Was alle mindestens wissen solltenâ€¢ Kindheit & Proof of Work: Schnee schippen, sparen, arbeiten â€“ Geld kommt nicht aus dem Nichts

â€¢ â€Die Lehrer haben nie an mich geglaubtâ€œ â€“ heute wundern sie sich Ã¼ber sein Buch

â€¢ Tinos Weg zu Bitcoin: 2016 Galileo, 2018 erste (Ver-)KÃ¤ufe, 2020 viele BÃ¼cher & Einstieg ins Rabbit Hole

â€¢ Bitcoin-Historie: Seit den 80/90ern wurden die Puzzleteile gelegt â€“ Satoshi Nakamoto fÃ¼gte sie perfekt zusammen

â€¢ Hot Take eines Immobilienprofis: â€Immobilien sind viel risikobehafteter als Bitcoin!â€œ (BegrÃ¼ndung in der Folge)


ğŸ“— Zum Buch von Tino â€“ Im Labyrinth des Geldes â€“ Wie Bitcoin neue Wege Ã¶ffnet

â€¢ Sehr einfacher Einstieg, keine harte Kost

â€¢ 92 Seiten: an einem Tag lesbar

â€¢ Entstanden als spontane Idee aus den VHS-Kursenâ€¢ Soll Lust auf mehr machen (keine Verkaufsveranstaltung)

â€¢ Einfach anfangen

â€¢ Ab einem Monatsgehalt in Bitcoin: auf Cold Storage (z. B. BitBox) wechseln

item.title: The Breakdown â€“ Morgan Stanley Goes All In on Crypto
item.description:
Morgan Stanley makes a major bet on crypto adoption by filing for in-house Bitcoin and Solana ETFs, a sharp reversal that signals real demand inside its massive wealth management network and another step toward crypto becoming table stakes for traditional finance. The episode also covers MSCIâ€™s decision to keep MicroStrategy in its indexes, the resulting rebound across crypto treasury companies and miners, and why index inclusion still matters so much for price action. Finally, thereâ€™s an update from Washington, where a crypto market structure bill heads toward a contentious committee vote, with stablecoin yield, AML provisions, and banking lobby pressure setting up one of the clearest regulatory showdowns yet.

item.title: The Bitcoin Layer â€“ $1 QUADRILLION In Global Wealth: How Does It Impact Bitcoin?
item.description:
In this episode, Nik Bhatia and Demian Schatt step back from short-term liquidity signals to examine the global balance sheet and its implications for Bitcoin. They break down why global wealth has decoupled from GDP, how financialization and credit expansion reshaped the world economy, and why policymakers have become increasingly resistant to prolonged contraction. Nik explains how Bitcoin fits into a system with nearly $1 quadrillion in existing net worth, why adoption and credit expansion matter more than simple rotation narratives, and what this framework means for Bitcoinâ€™s long-term trajectory.

item.title: All In Bitcoin â€“ 023 All In Bitcoin With CK 2025: The Recap
item.description:
In this end-of-year recap, our guests: Adam Back, Peter Todd, John Carvalho, Jameson Lopp, Rockstar Dev, Martti Malmi, Trace Mayer, Alex B, Pierre Rochard, Jimmy Song, Jack Kruse, Mike Peterson, Nicolas Burtey, Willy Woo, Ben Perrin, Abubakar Nur Khalil, Jeff Booth, Derek Ross, and Max Kei challenge the narratives. We unpack what actually made Bitcoin launch, explain mining, explore how Bitcoin scales beyond Lightning, and examine the real risks facing Bitcoin Core, stablecoins, and censorship resistance. From Nostr and digital identity to government failure and capital fleeing broken systems, El Salvadorâ€™s frustrations, environmentalism exposed, the challenges and realities behind gold verification, and why building Bitcoin businesses remains the toughest industry of all.

This episode captures the uncomfortable truths of 2025 and much more, carrying us forward into the new year. Thank you for being with us this year! Hereâ€™s to many more great episodes to come next year. A small New Yearâ€™s favor: please subscribe and hit the bell. It really helps us push the conversation further, reach new audiences, share the message of Bitcoin, and gives us the motivation to keep going, keep traveling, keep preparing, and keep bringing you in-person conversations. Wishing you the best, CK and the All in Bitcoin team

item.title: Einfach Bitcoin Podcast â€“ Wie funktioniert eine Bitcoin-Adresse
item.description:
---werbung---
N26 ist ein kostenloses, mobiles Konto, das du in wenigen Minuten erÃ¶ffnest â€“ mit der MÃ¶glichkeit, Finanzprodukte und Krypto zu kaufen, Rechnungen mÃ¼helos mit Freunden zu teilen und sogar PrÃ¤mien zu erhalten, wenn du andere einlÃ¤dst. Wenn du ein Konto suchst, das dir dein Finanzleben wirklich erleichtert, ist jetzt der perfekte Moment, einzusteigen.
        JETZT KOSTENLOS ANMELDEN!
---werbung---
 Bitcoin hat in den letzten Jahren Millionen von Menschen fasziniert. Ob als digitales Zahlungsmittel, Wertanlage oder technologische Revolution â€“ die erste KryptowÃ¤hrung der Welt verÃ¤ndert, wie wir Ã¼ber Geld denken. Doch wer das erste Mal mit Bitcoin zu tun hat, stÃ¶ÃŸt schnell auf einen Begriff, der alles andere als selbsterklÃ¤rend ist: die Bitcoin-Adresse. Was ist sie genau, wie entsteht sie, und warum ist sie so wichtig fÃ¼r die Sicherheit und AnonymitÃ¤t des Bitcoin-Systems? 

Um diese Fragen zu verstehen, mÃ¼ssen wir einen Blick hinter die Kulissen werfen â€“ in die Welt der Kryptografie, Hashfunktionen und digitalen SchlÃ¼ssel. Denn die Bitcoin-Adresse ist nicht einfach eine â€Kontonummerâ€œ, sondern das Ergebnis einer komplexen mathematischen Struktur, die Vertrauen ohne zentrale Instanz ermÃ¶glicht. 

 
Was ist eine Bitcoin-Adresse eigentlich? 

Eine Bitcoin-Adresse ist das digitale Pendant zu einer Kontonummer â€“ aber viel sicherer, dezentraler und anonymer. Sie ist eine Zeichenfolge aus Buchstaben und Zahlen, die mit einer bestimmten Ziffernfolge beginnt, zum Beispiel mit einer 1, 3 oder bc1. Diese Zeichenfolge reprÃ¤sentiert den Ã¶ffentlichen Teil eines kryptografischen SchlÃ¼sselpaares und dient dazu, Bitcoin zu empfangen. 

Im Gegensatz zu einem Bankkonto steht hinter einer Bitcoin-Adresse kein Name, keine IdentitÃ¤t und keine Bank. Stattdessen basiert sie vollstÃ¤ndig auf Mathematik. Jeder kann in Sekundenschnelle eine neue Adresse generieren â€“ kostenlos und ohne Registrierung. Die Adresse selbst wird aus einem Public Key abgeleitet, der wiederum aus einem Private Key entsteht. Nur der Besitzer des Private Keys kann Ã¼ber die Bitcoins verfÃ¼gen, die auf eine bestimmte Adresse gesendet wurden.

Wie entsteht eine Bitcoin-Adresse technisch? 

Hinter einer scheinbar zufÃ¤lligen Zeichenkette verbirgt sich ein raffinierter Prozess. Eine Bitcoin-Adresse entsteht durch eine Abfolge kryptografischer Schritte, die dafÃ¼r sorgen, dass sie sowohl einzigartig als auch sicher ist. 

Alles beginnt mit einem zufÃ¤llig generierten Private Key. Dieser SchlÃ¼ssel ist eine 256-Bit-Zahl â€“ also eine extrem groÃŸe Zahl, die fast unmÃ¶glich zu erraten ist. Im Laufe der Bitcoin-Entwicklung haben sich verschiedene Adressformate etabliert, die unterschiedliche technische HintergrÃ¼nde haben. item.title: The Why Bitcoin Show â€“ #94 - The Christmas Special 2025 Edition (Emotional Times)
item.description:
It's that magical time of the year when we get together with Daz, Brendo and Hats and talk about the year that's been.

CAUTION: Brendo's sound was weak AF and we apologise for that! Also, I dropped numerous F-bombs and even a cheeky C-word for the eagle-eared listener. Just a heads up in case you wanted to share this one with the kids.

This one was a particularly sombre one, not just because the price action was appalling, but perhaps more so, that we've grown up.


In this episode we touched on:

- price action

- working in Bitcoin

- is crypto dead?

- treasury companies

- what we learnt over the past year


Special thanks to my returning guests, give them a follow:

item.title: Bald in Bitcoin â€“ Folge 3 - Warum funktioniert Bitcoin Ã¼berhaupt?
item.description:
Thema der Folge: Warum Bitcoin funktioniert â€“ knapp, sicher und dezentral

In dieser Episode erfÃ¤hrst du: â€¢ Warum Bitcoin niemandem gehÃ¶rt und nicht gesteuert werden kann â€¢ Wie DezentralitÃ¤t in der Praxis funktioniert â€¢ Weshalb es keinen â€Ausschaltknopfâ€œ fÃ¼r Bitcoin gibt â€¢ Warum die feste Begrenzung auf 21 Millionen Bitcoin entscheidend ist â€¢ Wieso diese Eigenschaften Vertrauen schaffen â€“ auch ohne zentrale Instanz

FÃ¼r wen ist die Folge gedacht? FÃ¼r Menschen ab 50+, die Bitcoin verstehen wollen, ohne Technik, Hype oder Spekulation â€“ sondern mit klarem Blick auf die Grundlagen.

Begriffe aus der Folge (einfach erklÃ¤rt): â€¢ Dezentral: Kein zentraler Betreiber, viele unabhÃ¤ngige Teilnehmer â€¢ Knappheit: Bitcoin ist mathematisch begrenzt â€¢ Netzwerk: Weltweite Computer, die gemeinsam die Regeln einhalten

Podcast: Bald in Bitcoin â€“ Digitales Geld fÃ¼r analog Geborene Moderator: Tom

ğŸ§ Jetzt reinhÃ¶ren und verstehen, was Bitcoin im Kern zusammenhÃ¤lt.

item.title: THE Bitcoin Podcast â€“ 4chan Lawyer: How America Is Pushing Back Against UK & EU Censorship | Preston Byrne
item.description:
Preston Byrne is a technology and free-speech lawyer whoâ€™s been on the front lines of a growing international battle over online speech. We dig into how governments in the UK, EU, and Australia are attempting to project their censorship regimes onto American companies, and why

Preston is representing platforms like 4chan and Kiwi Farms in direct opposition to those efforts.

We explore the UKâ€™s Online Safety Act, the escalating push for age verification and VPN crackdowns, and why these laws pose a direct threat to the First Amendment. We also unpack the GRANITE Act, emerging U.S. political pushback, and what this all means for the future of free speech, privacy, Bitcoin culture, and the open internet.

If you care about sovereignty, free expression, and why Americans are saying â€œcome and take itâ€ to foreign regulators, this episode is for you.

FOLLOW PRESTON: X: https://x.com/prestonjbyrne

Website: https://prestonbyrne.com/

item.title: Bitcoiners - Live From Bitcoin Beach â€“ Is El Salvador The LAST Place To Escape The Great Reset? (2026 Second Passport Guide) | Jennifer Harding
item.description:
Is your citizenship a rug pull waiting to happen?Â 

We sit down with legal expert Jennifer Harding Marlin (@jh_marlin) to discuss why relying on a single fiat passport is a massive single point of failure. We explore the harsh truth for Americans facing restrictive FATCA banking regulations and why entrepreneurs are forced to renounce US citizenship just to protect their stack and keep their businesses alive.

Jennifer breaks down the citizenship by investment industry for those looking to opt out of the system completely. We navigate the maze of golden visa programs available right now to determine where you should plant your flag. From the lightning-fast El Salvador Freedom Visa to traditional Caribbean options we compare the best citadels. She highlights the ability to pay for a new nationality directly in Bitcoin for those looking to exit the fiat banking rails entirely.

We also get into the operational security of securing your freedom. You will learn the difference between applying for a temporary digital nomad visa and securing a permanent high-security biometric passport that guarantees global mobility. Jennifer explains how to navigate the bureaucracy of background checks and apostille services to ensure you actually get approved.Â 

Subscribe to the channel to build your sovereign portfolio and drop a comment if you would move countries for better money laws

-Bitcoin Beach Team


Connect and Learn more about Jennifer Harding:

X: https://x.com/jh_marlin
YT: https://www.youtube.com/@JenniferHardingMarlincitizen
Web: https://jhmarlin.com/Â 


Support and follow Bitcoin Beach:

X: https://www.twitter.com/BitcoinBeach
IG: https://www.instagram.com/bitcoinbeach_sv
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@livefrombitcoinbeach
Web: https://www.bitcoinbeach.comÂ 


Browse through this quick guide to learn more about the episode:

00:00Â  IntroÂ 
02:26Â  How to become a citizenship lawyer in CaribbeanÂ 
06:50Â  Best second passport for weak passport holdersÂ 
09:44Â  Why American entrepreneurs renounce citizenship FATCA bankingÂ 
13:15Â  New citizenship by investment programs 2025 Sao TomeÂ 
17:30Â  El Salvador Freedom Visa processing time vs St Kitts citizenshipÂ 
22:10Â  Cheapest vs most expensive citizenship by investment 2025Â 
28:40Â  Is foreign income tax-free in El Salvador for US expatsÂ 
33:14Â  Paraguay vs El Salvador residency requirements for digital nomadsÂ 
36:50Â  Can you get citizenship by investment with a criminal record



Live From Bitcoin Beach

item.title: The Bitcoin Boomers â€“ QE on Steroids, Bitcoin Business Revolution, Public Miner Doom | Gary Cardone
item.description:
Gary Cardone (energy veteran, fintech pioneer, and acclaimed artist) joins Larry Lepard, Bob Burnett, and Gary Leland for a no-holds-barred Bitcoin Boomers episode that exposes the fiat system's soul-crushing traps and Bitcoin's path to ultimate freedom. From the opening salvo, Gary drops bombs: "Bitcoin is the primary business without an HR department," freeing him from "dumb meetings about dumb subjects" to pursue art and self-discovery.

The crew dismantles fiat's "treadmill" (Larry: "The only thing more limited than Bitcoin is your timeâ€”and Bitcoin gives it back"), warns of ethical "prostitution" in corporate ladders, and reveals how creatives spot Bitcoin's magic first by thinking outside the box. Bob slams public miners' impending doom amid 2025's $8.6B M&A frenzy and harsh margins, while championing decentralized energy "sinkholes" for wasted power.

Larry's prescient "big print" prophecy hits home as the Fed ended QT in December 2025, restarting QE with $40B/month Treasury buys amid liquidity strainsâ€”fueling Bitcoin's hedge role despite its dip to ~$87K from $126K highs. They debate deflationary shocks from immigration policies, why success isn't chasing dollars (Gary: "Even billionaires don't get freedom"), and raw advice for young stackers: ditch consumerism, seek mentors, pay yourself first with 10% in BTC for compounding magic.This is the orange-pill blueprint for boomers and millennials alikeâ€”escape fiat's rat race before the next debasement wave.

If you're tired of quarterly BS and ready for Bitcoin's no-HR revolution, hit play now. Key Topics: Bitcoin as the ultimate freedom machine from fiat drudgery Why creatives embrace Bitcoin faster than suits Ditching "dumb meetings" and HR nightmares for self-fulfillment Fiat's ethical traps: "Prostitution" in corporate climbing

The big print on steroids: Fed's 2025 QE restart and Bitcoin's explosion potential Public miners' doom: 2025 M&A wave, inefficiencies, and AI bailouts Decentralized mining's future: Energy "sinkholes" for zero-cost production Deflationary shocks ahead: Immigration, peak consumption, and opportunity Young guns guide: Mentors over MBAs, 10% savings in BTC, ditch the Rolls Compounding's wonders: From acorns to oak trees in a Bitcoin world

About Gary A former natural gas insider turned Bitcoin multi-millionaire, Gary blends decades of experience in energy, finance, and tech into hard-hitting insights. â€¢ Website: https://garycardone.me/ â€¢ Twitter: @GaryCardone

Hosts: Lawrence Lepard (@LawrenceLepard): Sound money advocate, fund manager, author of "The Big Print" Bob Burnett (@boomer_btc): Bitcoin evangelist, Founder/CEO of Barefoot Mining, former CTO at Gateway Inc. Board member at Ocean with over 40 years in tech and mining. Gary Leland (@GaryLeland): Founder of Bit Block Boom Bitcoin Conference. Supported By: Blockstream Jade: Easy, open-source Bitcoin-only cold storage.

Visit BITCOINWELL.COM/BTCSESSIONS Book Private Sessions: Master Bitcoin with experts at bitcoinmentor.io.

item.title: Bitcoin, Fiat & Rock'n'Roll â€“ Gold meets Code: Tokenizing Gold for the Digital Age
item.description:
Weâ€™re kicking off something new at Bitcoin, Fiat & Rockâ€™nâ€™Roll (BFRR): the Digital Money Interview Seriesâ€”powered by our podcast partner etonec (and transparency: Jonas also works with etonec). About once a month, weâ€™ll sit down with builders and operators whoâ€™ve shipped financial products at scaleâ€”less hype, more hard-won lessons.

For the inaugural episode, Jonas is joined by new guest host Jonathan Knoll (ex Sun Microsystems, PayPal, and one of the early hires at the Libra Association). Together, they unpack why the â€œLibra eraâ€ still matters, how it acted as a catalyst for regulation and institutional focus, and why stablecoins have entered a critical â€œscaling phaseâ€ where trust, governance, and real customer needs matter more than clever tech. Jonathan riffs on Libra as â€œNapster vs. Spotifyâ€â€”a necessary catalystâ€”and shares a PayPal litmus test he learned the hard way: â€œWhy would a customer do that?â€

Then we go deep on a different kind of stable asset: gold-backed tokens. Our guest is Kurt Hemecker, CEO behind DGLD (and CEO of Gold Token SA, a wholly owned subsidiary of MKS PAMP). We explore:

â€¢ Why tokenize gold at allâ€”and what problems it solves vs. physical gold and ETFs â€¢ What â€œasset-backedâ€ really means, and why custody, insurance, audits, and redemption are non-negotiable â€¢ The Lindy effect, trust, and why goldâ€™s thousands-year track record still shapes digital money â€¢ How DGLD works today (1 token = 1 troy ounce, fractional possible), where itâ€™s live (Ethereum & Base), where it trades (DEXs like Uniswap and Aerodrome), and how redemption can go down to 1 gram (via Gold Avenue) â€¢ The roadmap: multi-chain expansion, institutional use cases (collateral, repo, lending), and future exchange listings â€¢ Plus: BTC vs fiat vs goldâ€”what people really â€œbelieve in,â€ and why that matters

If you care about tokenization, stablecoins, and the future of monetary infrastructureâ€”this oneâ€™s for you. Subscribe, leave a review, and follow BFRR on LinkedIn and YouTube for future guests worldwide.

LinkedIn Jonas Gross

LinkedIn Jonathan Knoll

LinkedIn Kurt Hemecker

X account Kurt Hemecker

etonec Website

[DGLD Product Website](https://dgld.com/

Official DGLD X Account)[[https://x.com/DGLD_Official]

Bitcoin, Fiat & Rock'n'Roll Website

item.itunes:summary:
Weâ€™re kicking off something new at Bitcoin, Fiat & Rockâ€™nâ€™Roll (BFRR): the Digital Money Interview Seriesâ€”powered by our podcast partner etonec (and transparency: Jonas also works with etonec). About once a month, weâ€™ll sit down with builders and operators whoâ€™ve shipped financial products at scaleâ€”less hype, more hard-won lessons.

For the inaugural episode, Jonas is joined by new guest host Jonathan Knoll (ex Sun Microsystems, PayPal, and one of the early hires at the Libra Association). Together, they unpack why the â€œLibra eraâ€ still matters, how it acted as a catalyst for regulation and institutional focus, and why stablecoins have entered a critical â€œscaling phaseâ€ where trust, governance, and real customer needs matter more than clever tech. Jonathan riffs on Libra as â€œNapster vs. Spotifyâ€â€”a necessary catalystâ€”and shares a PayPal litmus test he learned the hard way: â€œWhy would a customer do that?â€

Then we go deep on a different kind of stable asset: gold-backed tokens. Our guest is Kurt Hemecker, CEO behind DGLD (and CEO of Gold Token SA, a wholly owned subsidiary of MKS PAMP). We explore:

â€¢ Why tokenize gold at allâ€”and what problems it solves vs. physical gold and ETFs â€¢ What â€œasset-backedâ€ really means, and why custody, insurance, audits, and redemption are non-negotiable â€¢ The Lindy effect, trust, and why goldâ€™s thousands-year track record still shapes digital money â€¢ How DGLD works today (1 token = 1 troy ounce, fractional possible), where itâ€™s live (Ethereum & Base), where it trades (DEXs like Uniswap and Aerodrome), and how redemption can go down to 1 gram (via Gold Avenue) â€¢ The roadmap: multi-chain expansion, institutional use cases (collateral, repo, lending), and future exchange listings â€¢ Plus: BTC vs fiat vs goldâ€”what people really â€œbelieve in,â€ and why that matters

If you care about tokenization, stablecoins, and the future of monetary infrastructureâ€”this oneâ€™s for you. Subscribe, leave a review, and follow BFRR on LinkedIn and YouTube for future guests worldwide.

LinkedIn Jonathan Knoll

item.title: Bitcoin Audible â€“ Chat_156 - Simplifying Sovereignty with Praveen
item.description:
"My problem with the core side has been what we talked about with the people that are technical and don't have the empathy or understand what it was like before you were [technical]. The core people are so dismissive and the hubris is so high that they dismiss these people that are not technical but understand Bitcoin as money right.

"I always say, like my Twitter phrase, Bitcoin is not open source software. Obviously that doesn't mean it's not open source, it's just so much more than that. It's not just a piece of software, it is money."

~ Praveen Perera

Managing private keys remains one of the steepest learning curves for new Bitcoiners. How do we get people off exchanges and into self-custody without the terrifying risk of user error?

I sit down with Praveen Perera, the builder behind Cove Wallet, to talk about his unique approach to simplified backups using Passkeys and encrypted cloud storage. We discuss the philosophy of building focused, single-purpose tools versus the 'super app' trend, and dig into the technical trade-offs of his architecture.

We also wander into the implications of 'vibe coding' with AI, the contentious debates around network spam, and why maintaining a diverse ecosystem of wallet implementations might be crucial for Bitcoin's resilience.

Check out our awesome sponsors!

  • Ledn: Need fiat but donâ€™t want to sell your Bitcoin? Ledn offers secure, Bitcoin-backed loans with no credit checks, flexible repayment, and fast turnaroundâ€”often within 24 hours. With $10B+ in loans across 100+ countries and transparent Proof of Reserves, Ledn is a trusted option for unlocking liquidity without giving up your Bitcoin. (Link: https://learn.ledn.io/audible)
  • HRF: The Human Rights Foundation is a nonpartisan, nonprofit organization that promotes and protects human rights globally, with a focus on closed societies. Subscribe to HRF's Financial Freedom Newsletter today. (Link: https://mailchi.mp/hrf.org/financial-freedom-newsletter)
  • OFF: The Oslo Freedom Forum is a global human rights event by the Human Rights Foundation (HRF), uniting voices from activism, journalism, tech, and beyond. Through powerful stories and collaboration, OFF advances freedom and human potential worldwide. Join us next June. (Link: https://oslofreedomforum.com/)
  • Pubky:Â Pubky is building the next web, a decentralized system designed to put control back in your hands. Escape censorship, algorithmic manipulation, and walled gardens by owning your identity and data. Explore the Pubky web and become the algorithm today. Don't forget to find me on my Pubky ID here: pk:5d7thwzkxx5mz6gk1f19wfyykr6nrwzaxri3io7ahejg1z74qngo. (Link: https://pubky.org)
  • Chroma: Chroma is dedicated to advancing human performance and well-being through cutting-edge light therapy devices and performance eyewear. Their mission is to enhance physical and mental health, unlocking peak human health, cognitive function, and physical performance. Get 10% off your order with the code BITCOINAUDIBLE. (Link: https://getchroma.co/?ref=BitcoinAudible)

Guest Links

  • Praveen on X (Link: https://x.com/PraveenPerera)
  • Cove Wallet on X (Link: https://x.com/covewallet)
  • Cove Wallet Website (Link: https://covebitcoinwallet.com/)
  • Cove Wallet on Github (Link: https://github.com/bitcoinppl/cove)

Host Links

  • â Guy on Nostr â (Link: http://tinyurl.com/2xc96ney)
  • â Guy on X â (Link: https://twitter.com/theguyswann)
  • Guy on Instagram (Link: https://www.instagram.com/theguyswann)
  • Guy on TikTok (Link: https://www.tiktok.com/@theguyswann)
  • Guy on YouTube (Link: https://www.youtube.com/@theguyswann)
  • â Bitcoin Audible on Xâ  (Link: https://twitter.com/BitcoinAudible)
  • The Guy Swann Network Broadcast Room on Keet (Link: https://tinyurl.com/3na6v839)

item.title: Thank God for Bitcoin â€“ TGFB Episode 73: If You're Going To Win, You're Going To Have To Plod: A Convo With Nate Spearing
item.description:
Nathan Spearing shares his journey from a military career to entrepreneurship, emphasizing the importance of time, family, and courage in making life decisions. He discusses the challenges of transitioning from a structured military environment to the uncertainties of business, and the significance of building a legacy for future generations.

Nathan Spearing and Jordan Bush explore various themes related to education, biblical principles of sowing and reaping, the importance of community, and the role of prayer in daily life. The conversation also touches on practical wisdom for preparing for the future, the significance of Bitcoin as a new perspective on wealth before closing with a few practial Bitcoin questions.

]]>

Angefangen als Banklehrling bei der Sparkasse, hat er frÃ¼h den Wandel von Beratung hin zu reinem Vertrieb erlebt und sich auf IT-Projekte spezialisiert. In diesem GesprÃ¤ch erzÃ¤hlt er, wie er von der Banken IT zu Bitcoin kam, warum er mit seiner Frau einen Roman Ã¼ber Geld schrieb und wie er sich heute zwischen Beratung und Content rund um Bitcoin positioniert.

item.title: BTC-ECHO | Bitcoin & Krypto Podcasts â€“ Marktupdate #39 | MicroStrategy bleibt im MSCI â€“ Bitcoin & Altcoins vor dem nÃ¤chsten Move?
item.description:
Crash abgesagt?

Der 15-Milliarden-Dollar-Crash ist vom Tisch! Entgegen aller Prognosen fliegt MicroStrategy nicht aus dem MSCI World Index. Zumindest vorerst. Wir analysieren Michael Saylors Last-Minute-Coup und die noch verhaltene Wirkung auf den Bitcoin-Kurs. On-Chain-Daten deuten derweil auf eine Akkumulation durch Institutionen â€“ braut sich jetzt ein massiver Supply-Shock zusammen? AuÃŸerdem blicken wir auf diese steile These: WÃ¤hrend Bitcoin sich als stabiles Makro-Asset etabliert, kÃ¶nnte der â€œClarity Actâ€œ 2026 fÃ¼r das langersehnte institutionelle Repricing bei Altcoins sorgen. Ist das der Startschuss fÃ¼r Ethereum, Solana & Co.?

Themen dieser Folge:

ğŸŒ MSCI Rauswurf abgewendet: Was das fÃ¼r die Kurse von BTC und MSTR bedeutet

ğŸ” Bitcoin Kaufsignale: Warum die Onchain-Daten Ã¼berraschen.

ğŸ›ï¸ Clarity Act vor Entscheidung: Welchen Effekt hat die regulatorische Klarheit auf ETH, SOL und Co.?

Willst du den Podcast als Video sehen? Dann schau auf unseren YouTube-Kanal vorbei https://youtube.com/live/iiAbFoqty7U

Entdecke jetzt alle weiteren Angebote von BTC-ECHO: ğŸš€ BTC-ECHO PLUS+: https://www.btc-echo.de/shop/ ğŸ“± App: ğŸ¤– https://bit.ly/3qApBTw / ğŸ https://apple.co/3wCHhS0 ğŸ“œReports: https://www.btc-echo.de/reports/ ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ“ Academy: https://bit.ly/3BsraFk

]]>

AuÃŸerdem blicken wir auf diese steile These: WÃ¤hrend Bitcoin sich als stabiles Makro-Asset etabliert, kÃ¶nnte der â€œClarity Actâ€œ 2026 fÃ¼r das langersehnte institutionelle Repricing bei Altcoins sorgen. Ist das der Startschuss fÃ¼r Ethereum, Solana & Co.?

Themen dieser Folge:

ğŸŒ MSCI Rauswurf abgewendet: Was das fÃ¼r die Kurse von BTC und MSTR bedeutet

ğŸ” Bitcoin Kaufsignale: Warum die Onchain-Daten Ã¼berraschen.

ğŸ›ï¸ Clarity Act vor Entscheidung: Welchen Effekt hat die regulatorische Klarheit auf ETH, SOL und Co.?

Willst du den Podcast als Video sehen? Dann schau auf unseren YouTube-Kanal vorbei https://youtube.com/live/iiAbFoqty7U

item.title: VERIFIED by Bitcoin Suisse â€“ Crypto Outlook 2026
item.description:
In this episode of the Verified Podcast by Bitcoin Suisse, Dominic Weibel sits down with investment strategist DenisÂ Oevermann, crypto market analyst LucaÂ Gnos, and junior portfolio manager Mateo Sansonetti to dissect crypto's performance in 2025 and share their predictions for 2026.Â 
Â 
The discussion examines why 2025 was a year where crypto overdelivered on fundamentals but underdelivered on price. The panel explores new regulatory frameworks, the pro-crypto stance of the U.S. administration, and the disjointed performance between Bitcoin and altcoins. They analyze the explosive growth of options trading, the rise of prediction markets, and how macroeconomic factors and institutional flows will shape 2026.Â 
Â 
The conversation also tackles AI's market influence, the potential for Federal Reserve rate cuts, retail sentiment versus institutional positioning, and price predictions for Bitcoin and Ethereum heading into the new year.

]]>

item.title: Next in Crypto: Daily Insights on Bitcoin, Ethereum, DeFi & Web3 â€“ The Crypto Theses 2026: The Age of Cryptomoney and Convergence
item.description:
The provided podcast outlinesÂ The Crypto Theses 2026, a comprehensive outlook on the evolution of digital assets toward a more mature and institutionalizedÂ cryptomoneyÂ era. It highlightsÂ Bitcoinâ€™sÂ solidified role as the primary non-sovereign store of value, while noting thatÂ Layer-1Â platforms are increasingly valued for their monetary premiums rather than just network revenue. The report examines a majorÂ regulatory shiftÂ in the United States, where once-hostile environments have transitioned into strategic support, fostering growth inÂ stablecoinsÂ andÂ tokenized real-world assets. Emerging trends likeÂ application-specific money,Â AI-driven decentralized compute networks, and the rise ofÂ high-performance Layer-2sÂ are presented as the next frontiers for adoption. Furthermore, the analysis explores theÂ vertical integrationÂ of decentralized finance, where wallets and consumer-facing applications are becoming the primary gatekeepers of value capture. Ultimately, the source predicts a future where crypto infrastructure becomes the backbone for globalÂ financial settlement, cultural speculation, and autonomous agent commerce.

]]>

item.title: The CafÃ© Bitcoin Podcast â€“ Gigachad's $42B - $MSTR flips $COIN - Florida loves the corn
item.description:
In this episode of Swan Signal Live, hosts Brady Swenson and John Harr discuss various Bitcoin-related topics with guests Steven Lubka and Isaiah Douglas from Swan Bitcoin. The crew talks MicroStrategy's plan to raise $42 billion to buy more Bitcoin, the potential impact of the U.S. presidential election on Bitcoin's price, and the Florida CFO's push for a state Bitcoin reserve. They also compare MicroStrategy's Bitcoin holdings to Coinbase's and discuss Goldman Sachs' research on gold and its relevance to Bitcoin.
